content.title: National Savings Certificates (VIII-Issue) Scheme
content.beneficiary: Individuals looking to save and earn interest
content.details: The National Savings Certificates (VIII-Issue) Scheme is a savings instrument that encourages savings among the public and provides a fixed return on investment.
benefits: Tax benefits under Section 80C of the Income Tax Act
Transferable from one individual to another
Premature closure allowed under certain conditions
eligibility: Any individual can open an account
Joint accounts can be opened by two or more individuals
content.application_process: The applicant can visit the nearest Post Office Branch or a designated bank, fill out the application form, attach all required documents, and submit it with an initial deposit.

faqs.question: What happens if the account holder dies?
faqs.answer: In the event of the death of the depositor, the eligible balance in the account shall be payable to the nominee or legal heirs as specified in the scheme guidelines.

faqs.question: Can the account be transferred?
faqs.answer: Yes, the account may be transferred from one individual to another under certain conditions, such as the death of the account holder.

faqs.question: What is the process for premature closure?
faqs.answer: Premature closure is allowed under specific conditions, and the interest payable will depend on the duration the account has been held.
